item.title: Reply to https://jamesg.blog/2023/04/18/source-code-folder-names/
item.description: I've seen some people use either ~/code, ~/projects, or ~/programming. The first IDE I used was Eclipse and by default it would create projects under ~/workspace. Since then I've been using that as my source code directory but also...
item.content:encoded: I've seen some people use either ~/code, ~/projects, or ~/programming. The first IDE I used was Eclipse and by default it would create projects under ~/workspace. Since then I've been using that as my source code directory but also because its a small reference to Hackers (1995).

item.title: Watched Saint Frances, (2019) - ★★★★
item.description: Watched Saint Frances, (2019) - ★★★★

Things have been quiet over here but I did recently make some changes to my watched page. You can click on a star rating to view the list of movies that fall into that rating (for example: ★★★). Now that I have most of the features to track my...
item.content:encoded:
Things have been quiet over here but I did recently make some changes to my watched page. You can click on a star rating to view the list of movies that fall into that rating (for example: ★★★).

Now that I have most of the features to track my movie watches on here I might try to get access to the Letterboxd API so that I can POSSE to there.

item.title: Reply to https://jamesg.blog/2023/04/14/tea-routines-uk/
item.description: Back home in Ecuador I don't remember anyone drinking tea unless it was for medicinal purposes (stomach ache, nausea, cold). We do coffee multiple times a day, and I still usually drink a cup of coffee right before bed. Tea culture in the UK...
item.content:encoded:
Back home in Ecuador I don't remember anyone drinking tea unless it was for medicinal purposes (stomach ache, nausea, cold). We do coffee multiple times a day, and I still usually drink a cup of coffee right before bed.

Tea culture in the UK was always fascinating to me so a few years ago I spent some time trying to learn how to make a proper cup of tea. I'm not sure if I got there but I sometimes will have my version of that as a treat.
